basics.name: Matthew Asker
basics.label: Applied Mathematics PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD student in Applied Mathematics using non-equilibrium statistical physics, population dynamics, and evolutionary game theory to study eco-evolutionary dynamics, antimicrobial resistance, and species diversity.

awards.title: Travel Grant
awards.summary: An award of £500 to provide partial support for UK-based early career researchers to attend conferences or undertake research visits.

awards.title: Best talk in Applied Mathematics
awards.summary: Prize given to the best talk in the Applied Mathematics department at the annual PGR conference.

awards.title: PRACE Summer of HPC Scholarship
awards.awarder: Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe (PRACE)
awards.summary: Scholarship covering accommodation, travel costs, and stipend for intensive 2-month research programme at a HPC centre (held remotely due to COVID).

awards.title: Physics Entrance Scholarship
awards.summary: Award of £1000 for outstanding pre-university exam results (A*A*A*).

publications.name: Fixation and extinction in time-fluctuating spatially structured metapopulations

publications.publisher: Journal of the Royal Society Interface

projects.name: L24EEDs Workshop
projects.summary: Co-organised the Leeds 2024 Eco-Evolutionary Dynamics workshop with around 65 attendees. Hosted invited speakers and contributed speakers from several international universities.
